text: [Music]
everything in life is genetics all
living things are made of genes the
trees the beautiful flowers we smell our
favorite pets all of these are made up
of genes which control our traits and
how we behave my name is Mike Snyder I'm
professor and chair of genetics at
Stanford University I'm also the
director for the center for genomics and
personalized medicine in this class
we're going to learn what is genetics
and why should we bother studying it
it's a study of life and the way it is
and how traits are passed from one
person to the next it's a study of
natural inherited traits our hair color
our eye colors our personalities all
these are controlled by genetics we're
also going to have a better
understanding of how diseases work and
how to take charge of your health and
you need to know genetics in order to
think about disease and how to treat
yourself and others and in fact this
information is very very critical for
health and future the adventure is about
to begin you're going to learn all the
way from DNA to its product the proteins
and RNA and we're going to learn about
how things work in the natural world so
we can better understand the world
around us including ourselves
[Music]
